intro: Cyrtandra gibbsiae, commonly known as the Hawaiian cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its tubular, showy flowers that typically range in color from white to pink. The plant is an herbaceous perennial with opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in montane rainforests. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
